Push Ups.name: Push ups
Push Ups.help:
To do a regular push-up, begin in a plank position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up to the starting position. Keep your core engaged throughout for stability. Start with a comfortable number of repetitions and gradually increase as you build strength.

To do a one handed push-up, begin in a plank position with one hand centered beneath your shoulder and the other behind your back. Lower your body by bending your elbow until your chest nearly touches the floor, then push back up. Keep your core tight and maintain balance throughout the movement. Start with a few reps on each side and progress as your strength improves.

Lifting.name: Lifting
Lifting.help:
Distribute evenly the weights between both hands. For example, if your objective is to lift 6kg, put 3kg to each weight (as you'll lift two weights, one for each hand).

Without dropping it, extend your arm vertically, and start moving it up and down, making your elbow go from a 90Âº angle to a 45Âº angle and then again to a 90Âº one (that would count as one lift).

Keep going until you do all the lifts specified (or the timer runs out)!

Walking.name: Walking
Walking.help: Wear comfortable shoes and clothing suitable for the weather. Begin by walking at a natural pace, allowing your arms to swing naturally at your sides. Focus on maintaining a good posture, with your back straight and your head up. You can vary your speed, incorporating brisk walking intervals to increase your heart rate. Walking can be done almost anywhere, so choose a route you enjoy. Aim for at least 30 minutes of walking per session, and gradually increase your duration and intensity as you build stamina.

Running.name: Running
Running.help: To start running, ensure you have comfortable running shoes and attire. Begin with a warm-up by walking briskly for 5-10 minutes to prepare your muscles. Start running at a pace that feels comfortable, and maintain a steady breathing pattern. Focus on keeping a good posture and staying relaxed. If you're a beginner, alternate between running and walking in intervals. Gradually increase your running time as your endurance improves. Cool down by walking for a few minutes and then stretching.

about.subheader: Discover who's behind the app you're (hopefully!) enjoying.

Checks if there's a new version of the app, and if there is, shows a modal with options on what to do about it.

updateFlow.updateAvailableText: A new version ({{latestVersion}}) is available. Please, update PersonaPlus to the latest version.
updateFlow.cantCheck: Couldn't check for updates. Please, try later (or manually check the repo).

whenToDo.question: What days will you exercise?
whenToDo.proTip: Tap a day to enable or disable it. Colored days are enabled, gray ones are disabled.

actualQuestions.durationMinutesHint: For how long will you hold?
actualQuestions.restDurationMinutesHint: Don't type "200", I see you coming.
actualQuestions.amountOfPushUpsHint: Tip: Balance the duration and number of push-ups. More push-ups in less time will be more challenging but will have a greater (and better) effect on your body. Fewer push-ups in more time will give you a more relaxed, beginner-friendly session.
actualQuestions.amountOfHandsPushUpHint: Basically, will you be doing push-ups with two hands (normal) or just one (advanced)? The default is two.
actualQuestions.reps: How many lifts will you do?
actualQuestions.repsHint: Tip: Balance the duration and number of lifts. More lifts in less time will be more complicated but will have a greater (and better) effect on your body. Fewer lifts in more time will give you a more relaxed and beginner-friendly session.
actualQuestions.dumbbellWeightHint: In kilograms. The total weight of the dumbbell (both discs and the barbell). If you have two dumbbells, indicate the weight of just one of them.
actualQuestions.amountOfHandsLiftingHint: Basically: one dumbbell, or two dumbbells, one in each hand? By default it's two.
actualQuestions.estimateSpeed: What pace will you run at?
actualQuestions.estimateSpeedHint: Of course you don't have to be exact, just try to estimate it.

tooLongSession.text: We're talking about {{equal}} minutes of exercise. Isn't that too much?
tooLongSession.subtext: You can still create the objective if you want, don't worry. We're just warning you, for your own good!

createActiveObjective.required: Required: Duration, Exercise, and at least one day of the week. Some specific exercises will have extra requirements: for example, "Lifting" requires you to specify how much weight you will be lifting.
createActiveObjective.createButtonHint: Creates the objective. If there are empty or invalid fields, the button won't do anything.

theThinkHour.summon: Tap here to choose the hour.
theThinkHour.TEMP_disclaimer2: The Daily Check is not functional YET - we are working on it. We already told you that PersonaPlus is still in development. The time you choose here will be saved and will start to be used as soon as we release the Daily Check.

notifications.subheader: PersonaPlus sends several reminders at random times (but not weird times like 3am) by default. You can disable (or re-enable) them here.

sessions.giveUpDescription: If you give up, all your progress will be lost! Can't you last a little longer?

aboutApp.subheader: PersonaPlus is an app to help you take care of your health. Free, private, and trying its best to improve every that the way it helps you. Hope you improve every day too!

aboutTheMaker.subheader:
I'm Zaka and I Make Stuff. It's a pleasure to dedicate as much time as possible to this app - which at the moment seems like a draft - so that it eventually becomes your best ally to improve as a person.

Give yourself a plus!

credits.hint: Show credits, a tribute to everyone who has helped make this app so great.

experiments.header: READ THIS OR YOU WILL EXPLODE!!
experiments.subheader: i mean you wont actually explode but pls read
experiments.disclaimer:
TL;DR: experiments are cool features I'm working on BUT aren't done yet. You get to try them early!! But they might have bugs, so I can't promise they won't cause issues.

If you find any problems (or have feedback), let me know*â€”your help the app better!

*On the 'About' page you got the official Instagram, you can message us there.

toggle.hint: Toggles the state of this experiment. If it is disabled, it enables it, and viceversa.
toggle.warning: Again, experiments are cool, but are also unstable. Proceed at your own risk!

experiments.exp_tracker: PersonaPlus asks you 'how fast you will run' to calculate the calories burned after a running session. Stupid, I know, that's what this experiment is for: a motion tracker (similar to apps like 'Adidas Running').
experiments.exp_report: Enables a page called 'Report' that shows (based on calculations that the app makes with your data) whether you are healthy / underweight / overweight, and how many calories you burn as a minimum per day to survive.

experimentNotes.exp_tracker: PS. You have the exp_tracker experiment enabled, so this value is useless and won't be used to estimate your speed.

noObjectives.noObjectives: You don't have any objective. Create one now!
noObjectives.todayFree: No objectives for today. Enjoy your break!

createObjective.hint: Opens a page from which you can create an active objective.

start.hint: Starts a live session for this objective.

today.noContent: Here you'll always see todays progress (as long as you have objectives for today that aren't done).
